snippet: The government also alleged that the group had violated Egypt’s sovereignty and insulted the judiciary after it issued a report criticizing top officials for mass shootings of Islamist protesters.
abstract: Egyptian government accuses nonprofit group Human Rights Watch of breaking the law, violating Egypt's sovereignty and insulting the judiciary for issuing report criticizing top officials for repeated mass shootings of Islamist demonstrators.
lead_paragraph: The government also alleged that the group had violated Egypt’s sovereignty and insulted the judiciary after it issued a report criticizing top officials for mass shootings of Islamist protesters.

headline.main: After Human Rights Watch Report, Egypt Says Group Broke Law
headline.print_headline: After Human Rights Watch Report, Egypt Says Group Broke Law
